text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia flavipila is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Plurinerves. It is native to an area in the Wheatbelt and Goldfields-Esperance regions of Western Australia.The spreading shrub typically grows to a height of 0.5 to 2 metres (2 to 7 ft). It blooms from May to September and produces yellow flowers.
